weekly_top_story.headline: NIH launches major precision-medicine cancer trial combining next-generation KRAS inhibitor with immunotherapy
weekly_top_story.summary: The NIH has initiated a large precision-oncology trial testing a new KRAS inhibitor in combination with immune checkpoint blockade across multiple solid tumors, marking one of the most ambitious efforts yet to target KRAS-mutant cancers and potentially reshape treatment standards for lung, colorectal, and pancreatic cancer.

stories.headline: FDA approves first-in-class gene-edited cell therapy for sickle cell disease in adolescents and adults
stories.summary: The FDA has granted approval to a CRISPR-based ex vivo gene-edited cell therapy for sickle cell disease, offering a potentially curative option for eligible patients and signaling a major leap forward for genomic medicine in routine hematology practice.

stories.headline: CMS proposes new value-based reimbursement model tying more hospital payments to outcomes and readmission performance
stories.summary: CMS has released a proposed rule to expand value-based purchasing by further linking hospital reimbursement to outcomes, readmissions, and quality metrics, which could materially change revenue streams and care management priorities for hospitals and health systems.

stories.headline: Major health system announces large-scale rollout of AI clinical decision support embedded in EHR for sepsis and deterioration
stories.summary: A leading U.S. health system has deployed an EHR-integrated AI model for real-time detection of sepsis and clinical deterioration across all inpatient sites, aiming to reduce mortality and length of stay while raising new questions about workflow change, alert fatigue, and governance.
